title: Beet Salad with Ricotta Salata and Olives
summary: Beet Salad with Ricotta Salatan and Olives might be just the side dish you are searching for. For $1.03 per serving, this recipe covers 7% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe makes 6 servings with 194 calories, 2g of protein, and 17g of fat each. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. A mixture of arugula, salt, extra virgin olive oil, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 2 hours. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, primal, and vegetarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 40%. This score is pretty good. Try Chioggia Beet Salad with Ricotta Salatan and Hazelnuts, Roasted Beet Salad With Ricotta Salatan And Pistachios, and Arugulan and Mint Salad with Oil-Cured Black Olives, Oranges, and Ricotta Salata for similar recipes.
instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Cut the beets into wedges or large dice, keeping different colors separate. Pound the garlic with  teaspoon salt in a mortar until smooth, then whisk in the lemon juice and olive oil. The dressing should be a little on the tart side. Toss the beets in enough dressing to coat lightly. Arrange them on a platter and garnish with arugula. Just before serving, tuck the cheese and olives among the greens. If any dressing remains, spoon it over the cheese.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Cut the beets into wedges or large dice, keeping different colors separate. Pound the garlic with  teaspoon salt in a mortar until smooth, then whisk in the lemon juice and olive oil. The dressing should be a little on the tart side. Toss the beets in enough dressing to coat lightly. Arrange them on a platter and garnish with arugula. Just before serving, tuck the cheese and olives among the greens. If any dressing remains, spoon it over the cheese.
